blocks.content: System hacking means gaining access to a computer or account by breaking through its security. In naval style, it is like boarding an enemy ship by entering through a weak door or unguarded section.
Password cracking means trying different passwords until one works. It is like trying multiple keys on a locked door of a ship until the right one opens it.

content: Brute Force – Try every possible password
Dictionary Attack – Use a list of common passwords
Hybrid Attack – Mix dictionary words with symbols or numbers
Command: hydra -l USERNAME -P WORDLIST.txt TARGET_IP service
Why: To try many passwords automatically and find the correct one

blocks.content: Web brute force means trying multiple passwords on a website login page. It is like trying different access codes on a digital lock until it opens.

content: Command: hydra -l USERNAME -P WORDLIST.txt TARGET_IP http-post-form
Why: To test many password combinations on a web login form
Hydra can attack: login pages, SSH, FTP, RDP, SMTP and more

blocks.content: We will use the Hydra Room on TryHackMe to practice password cracking and brute forcing. Whenever you see TARGET IP, use the IP provided inside the TryHackMe room.

content: Understand safe usage of brute force tools

blocks.content: >> MODULE 06 COMPLETE. NEXT WE MOVE TO MALWARE, TROJANS, AND COVERING TRACKS.
